intro: Luma dasyblasta, commonly known as the golden luma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. The fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature, attracting various wildlife species.
